intro: Oxytropis tschatkalensis, commonly known as the Karakorum locoweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it is adapted to survive in arid environments. Oxytropis tschatkalensis is part of the legume family and has a deep root system that helps it access water from deeper soil layers.
